title: Storytelling-Based Corporate Law Leadership Education: Case-Centered Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of corporate management and legal frameworks
context.additional_context: Role-playing and discussion-centered classes based on real corporate cases. Applies a simple feedback collection system using smartphone apps

learning_goals: Cultivate legal judgment skills applicable to real business situations by analyzing key corporate law precedents in a storytelling format.
Develop communication competencies to systematically convey legal issues using storytelling techniques.

Learners can participate in three or more simulations reconstructing real corporate dispute cases (e.g., contract breaches, intellectual property disputes), meet four or more of the five crisis management checklist stages (identification-analysis-response-evaluation-improvement), and achieve scores in three or more of the five decision-making rubric items (clarity, validity, timeliness, collaboration, risk management).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
